description: A versatile connector used to express consequence or to mark temporal sequence. Very common in both spoken and written French.
usage: Can be used to express logical consequence (like 'so') or temporal sequence (like 'then'). Often used at the beginning of a sentence or after a pause.

examples.french: Il pleut, alors je prends un parapluie.
examples.english: It's raining, so I'm taking an umbrella.

examples.french: Alors, qu'est-ce que tu en penses ?
examples.english: So, what do you think about it?

examples.french: J'ai fini mes devoirs, alors je peux sortir.
examples.english: I finished my homework, so I can go out.
examples.context: Cause and consequence in everyday situation

examples.french: Nous avons d'abord visité Paris, alors nous sommes allés à Lyon.
examples.english: We first visited Paris, then we went to Lyon.

notes: One of the most common and versatile connectors in French. Can also be used as a filler word in conversation.
